info.title: Stuart API
info.description:
This section details the full technical specification of the Stuart Delivery API. Please find additional content, help and guides in our Developer Community Forum
Before starting your integration, we strongly recommend reading our getting started guide and following the linked guidance, including signing up to the forum to receive announcements of API changes and updates that may impact your integration.

post.description: To start sending authenticated HTTP requests you need to get an OAuth access token using your client_id and client_secret keys

get.description:
Correct and valid addresses are a core aspect of being able to successfully conduct deliveries with Stuart. To ensure your addresses will be accepted by the Stuart API, be sure to read our addresses best practices.
We observe two types of addresses, precise and approximate, the definition of which can be found below. Note that when the address is approximate, a valid contact phone is required for successful validation.
Additionally, we recommend providing a valid phone number with every delivery request to ensure the best possible delivery experience

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Full-text address you want to validate

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone number is required if the address is approximate and must be in E.164 standard

example: address is missing and address is empty

get.description: Get the picking or delivery area of an open Stuart zone. This endpoint response is in GeoJSON standard

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of zone: pickup or dropoff

get.description:
Once your delivery is assigned to a courier, you can request their anonymous phone number. Once the delivery is complete, the phone number will expire.
Read more about our two-way anonymised calling.

parameters.name: delivery_id
parameters.description: Delivery id received in job creation response

example: Cannot create a phone call for the given delivery.

get.description: Get scheduling slots of 15 minutes which can be used to display directly to your customer on your site. These slots also allow you to recognise Stuart's opening and closing times for a given zone.

message.example: Invalid type. Valid types: pickup or dropoff.

post.description:
Request the price for a job (VAT excluded) by using the same request payload used to [create a job](#0de55537-941b-49f4-ba53-5672dc6edccf).
The minimal details required to get the pricing are the pickup and dropoff `address`, and `transport_type`/`package_type` information.

amount.description: Price of the job in the associated currency.

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to get an estimated time of arrival at the origin address for a given Job using exactly the same request body as the [Create a job](#0de55537-941b-49f4-ba53-5672dc6edccf) endpoint.
Read more about how you might use this endpoint in our Developer Community Forum.
Verify that the payload validity according to job's creation requirements

Request a Stuart courier to handle your job, we will optimise the route for you unless you specifically request otherwise.
By default, we will send a courier to you as soon as possible, we call this an 'instant job'. Note that instant jobs can only be created during operational hours.
To schedule a job in the future, define a valid pickup_at date/time up to 30 days into the future for a corporate account (invoiced monthly), and up to 6 days for a regular account (invoiced per order).
For further tips and advice on order scheduling, check out our order scheduling tips and best practices.

get.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve all the jobs created in your Stuart account from the last 90 days.
The results will come back paginated in descending order of the 'pickup_at' job scheduling value.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Max number of result you want per page.

parameters.name: client_reference
parameters.description: The client_reference used during the Job creation.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Boolean: Overrides the status to give only currently active orders.

get.description: Get the details of a job using the `id` in the response of your [job creation request](#0de55537-941b-49f4-ba53-5672dc6edccf).

example: address is missing and address is empty

patch.description:
Update some details of a job in accordance with the restrictions detailed below.
When the delivery status is `pending`, `picking`, `almost_picking`, `waiting_at_pickup` you can update:
  • client_reference
  • comment
  • package_description
  • origin.comment
  • origin.contact.firstname
  • origin.contact.lastname
  • origin.contact.phone
  • origin.contact.email
  • origin.contact.company
  • destination.comment
  • destination.contact.firstname
  • destination.contact.lastname
  • destination.contact.phone
  • destination.contact.email
  • destination.contact.company

When the delivery status is `delivering`, `almost_delivering`, `waiting_at_dropoff` you can update:
  • client_reference
  • comment
  • package_description
  • destination.comment
  • destination.contact.firstname
  • destination.contact.lastname
  • destination.contact.phone
  • destination.contact.email
  • destination.contact.company

When the delivery status is `delivered` you can only update the `client_reference`

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job's id returned in the job creation response

post.description: Cancel a job including all of it's deliveries. We advise providing your reason for cancelling to provide visibility for reporting, the allowed values are detailed in the parameters below.
Cancel a single delivery of your job. We advise providing your reason for cancelling to provide visibility for reporting, the allowed values are detailed in the parameters below.
Job creation webhook schema. Please use the ```clientReference``` to track your deliveries
Job update webhook schema. Please use the ```clientReference``` to track your deliveries
Delivery creation webhook schema. Please use the ```clientReference``` to track your deliveries
Delivery update webhook schema. Please use the ```clientReference``` to track your deliveries

get.description: Return a list of your current webhooks. Currently, you are able to have a maximum of **6** webhooks.

post.description: Create a webhook through the Stuart API.

get.description: Get information on a specific webhook that you have created. {webhookId} in the path refers to the webhook id generated when creating your webhook.

put.description: This endpoint allows you to update any webhooks you have created.

delete.description: This endpoint allows you to delete a particular webhook.

ZonesList.description: List of zones where Stuart is currently operating, these codes can be used to get zone coverage GeoJSON through the get zone coverage endpoint.

transport_type.description: We recommend providing package_type in pickups, rather than transport_type.

pickup_at.description: A datetime (ISO 8601) of when the courier should arrive at the pickup.

assignment_code.description: Internal invoicing reference number. Note that providing the same assignment_code and client_reference will prevent us from stacking your orders.

fleets.description: Array of fleet id's to be used only with dedicated fleet account set up. Read more about dedicated fleets & fleet targeting

pickups.description: The origin of the deliveries. Maximum of one pickup location per job.

address.description: Geographical address. Do not include values such as floor number, building names, apartment numbers and other details. Use the 'comment' field instead of this field.
address.example: 32 Coombe Ln Raynes Park London SW20 0LA

client_reference.description: Your internal reference. Should be used for tracking.

package_description.description: Optional package description for the courier. Flag age-restricted items in this field.

end_customer_time_window_start.description: A datetime (ISO 8601) indicating the start of the delivery window. format: date-time

end_customer_time_window_end.description: A datetime (ISO 8601) indicating the end of the delivery window. format: date-time

package_description.description: Optional package description for the courier. Flag age-restricted items in this field.

formatted_address.example: 32 Coombe Lane SW20 0LA London The United Kingdom
23 Ethelbert Road SW20 8QD London The United Kingdom

code.description: Value of the code to display or scan

type.description:
Type of code to display or scan.
- text: displays the access code value on the courier mobile app,
- qr_text: displays a qr code that you can scan on the courier mobile app,
- barcode_128: displays a barcode that you can scan on the courier mobile app,
- qr_text: displays a qr code that you can scan on the courier mobile app,
- scan_barcode_128: allows the courier to scan a barcode with the courier mobile app,
- scan_qr_text: allows the courier to scan a qr code with the courier mobile app,

title.description: Access code title, displayed on the courier'app

instructions.description: Access code instructions, displayed on the courier'app

pickups.address: 32 Coombe Ln, Raynes Park, London SW20 0LA

address.formatted_address: 32 Coombe Lane, SW20 0LA, London, The United Kingdom
23 Ethelbert Road, SW20 8QD, London, The United Kingdom
